ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: This is a seminar class, which requires no work outside the classroom.
Since this is a seminar course, there is no need to work on this course outside the classroom actually.
1~5 HOURS
1hour

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The course is very helpful for us to learn the ongoing research topics.
It helps us know more about biostats research. Very useful.
Many distinguished researchers in the field of biostatistics were invited to give presentations on their work to the BIOSTAT students. These seminars have been really helpful and enlightening.
Comprehensive
Please invite more industry leaders since many students may want to find jobs and work after Yale.
Hope to invite more statisticians in the next semester. In this year, there are too many people doing bioinformatics.
Very interesting.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He attended the seminar every time and made good introductions.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Prof. Crawford made a lot of efforts in inviting the speakers, organizing the seminars and encouraging students to attend, which were very helpful to BIOSTAT students.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  good
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Good job
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  considerate for students
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Responsible
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  great instructor and well organized seminars

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to another students because the course is very helpful and necessary.
Yes.
very good for graduate students

In this course, outstanding researchers in the BIOSTAT field are invited to give talks on their research every week. Students can get to know much more research topics in BIOSTAT and obtain inspirationfor their own research from these speakers. This is a very helpful course and should be recommmended to every student in BIOSTAT departmant and other related departments.
good overall
great
great seminar sessions
